unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Conditions Example: Geometric Distribution?
question_text:
Allison just started studying for her AP Statistics exam. She is unfamiliar with the material so she simply has to guess at the multiple choice questions. She decided to answer multiple-choice questions with five selections (A, B, C, D, and E) until she got one incorrect.
Does this situation involve the geometric distribution?

choices.text: Yes, since all conditions for the geometric distribution are followed
No, a fixed number of trials does not exist in this situation
No, because there is not the same probability of answering one question versus the next correctly
No, because success on each question is NOT independent of the next question
No, because there are more than two outcomes since five solutions exist to each question
